result.execSummary:
All charges against Craig James Bristol in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Craig James Bristol is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Craig James Bristol

records.addlTxt: 1:23 PM Defendant Craig James Bristol not in court.  Attorney Richard Russell McCue Jr in court for Craig James Bristol.  Attorney Alexander David Goulart in court for State of Wisconsin. Court orders case dismissed on the motion of the State.
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 13, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Letter to Courts from Attorney McCue

Activity: Waiver of Preliminary Hearing and Arraignment
Appearances by video/zoom: Court Official, Court Reporter, Court Clerk, and all Parties referenced in hearing minutes as in court.

01:05 PM Defendant Craig James Bristol in court appearing by video with attorney Richard Russell McCue also appearing by video.  Margaret Nan Ginocchio appeared by video  for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waives preliminary hearing freely and voluntarily, rights given.  Court binds Defendant over for the filing of an Information.  Information filed, copy to defendant, reading waived. Not guilty plea entered by attorney. Remand to branch 7 for scheduling.
Adjourned initial appearance on June 29, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
